sentence: Close state-level contests are nothing new in U.S.
Number of states where the winning candidate's popular-vote
margin was less than 2 percentage points, by year
Note: Our analysis starts in 1824 the first election for which statewide popular
votes were both determinative and reasonably reliably reported.
Source: Pew Research Center ana alysis Election data from Dave Leip's Atlas of U.S
